gum_upper_left.name: Upper Left Gum
gum_upper_left.hint: Bleeding, puffiness or recession → gingivitis/periodontitis; see hygiene + scaling.

gum_upper_right.name: Upper Right Gum
gum_upper_right.hint: Tender localized swelling may be a gum abscess; urgent cleaning/drainage.

gum_lower_left.name: Lower Left Gum
gum_lower_left.hint: Sensitivity at roots? Check for recession/abrasion; brush softer.

gum_lower_right.name: Lower Right Gum
gum_lower_right.hint: Bleeding with flossing is an early warning; don’t stop cleaning.

tooth_18.name: Tooth 18 (UR 3rd Molar)
tooth_18.hint: Wisdom tooth: impaction/pericoronitis common; swelling + fever → urgent.

tooth_17.name: Tooth 17 (UR 2nd Molar)
tooth_17.hint: Deep fissures trap plaque → caries; lingering hot/cold → pulpitis.

tooth_16.name: Tooth 16 (UR 1st Molar)
tooth_16.hint: Pain on bite/release suggests crack; consider onlay/crown.

tooth_15.name: Tooth 15 (UR 2nd Premolar)
tooth_15.hint: Caries/cracks possible; proximal food trap → soreness.

tooth_14.name: Tooth 14 (UR 1st Premolar)
tooth_14.hint: Sharp to cold sweet? Dentin exposure or early caries.

tooth_13.name: Tooth 13 (UR Canine)
tooth_13.hint: Chips/wear from bruxism; smooth-surface caries less common but possible.

tooth_12.name: Tooth 12 (UR Lateral Incisor)
tooth_12.hint: Erosion from reflux/eating disorders can thin enamel.

tooth_11.name: Tooth 11 (UR Central Incisor)
tooth_11.hint: Trauma/chips frequent; bonding often restores shape.

tooth_21.name: Tooth 21 (UL Central Incisor)
tooth_21.hint: Smooth-surface caries possible with frequent sugars.

tooth_22.name: Tooth 22 (UL Lateral Incisor)
tooth_22.hint: Acid erosion causes sensitivity; consider reflux screening.

tooth_23.name: Tooth 23 (UL Canine)
tooth_23.hint: Canines can show abrasion notches from hard brushing (V-shaped).

tooth_24.name: Tooth 24 (UL 1st Premolar)
tooth_24.hint: Proximal caries common; flossing helps prevent.

tooth_25.name: Tooth 25 (UL 2nd Premolar)
tooth_25.hint: Cracked-tooth pain = sharp on bite release.

tooth_26.name: Tooth 26 (UL 1st Molar)
tooth_26.hint: Lingering thermal pain → pulpitis; check deep caries.

tooth_27.name: Tooth 27 (UL 2nd Molar)
tooth_27.hint: Upper molar pain with sinus pressure → consider sinusitis mimic.

tooth_28.name: Tooth 28 (UL 3rd Molar)
tooth_28.hint: Impaction/caries common; pericoronitis causes bad taste + swelling.

tooth_48.name: Tooth 48 (LR 3rd Molar)
tooth_48.hint: Wisdom tooth: hygiene access poor → decay & gum infection.

tooth_47.name: Tooth 47 (LR 2nd Molar)
tooth_47.hint: Heavy chewing load → cracks; look for bite-release pain.

tooth_46.name: Tooth 46 (LR 1st Molar)
tooth_46.hint: Most restored tooth; check for recurrent decay under fillings.

tooth_45.name: Tooth 45 (LR 2nd Premolar)
tooth_45.hint: Food packing soreness → proximal caries or open contact.

tooth_44.name: Tooth 44 (LR 1st Premolar)
tooth_44.hint: Cold zings across several teeth → generalized sensitivity.

tooth_43.name: Tooth 43 (LR Canine)
tooth_43.hint: Cervical abrasion + sensitivity common; soften brushing technique.

tooth_42.name: Tooth 42 (LR Lateral Incisor)
tooth_42.hint: Wear facets suggest bruxism; consider night guard.

tooth_41.name: Tooth 41 (LR Central Incisor)
tooth_41.hint: Trauma chips common; bonding typically restores esthetics.

tooth_31.name: Tooth 31 (LL Central Incisor)
tooth_31.hint: Recession can expose root → cold sensitivity.

tooth_32.name: Tooth 32 (LL Lateral Incisor)
tooth_32.hint: Acidic diet/GERD erodes enamel; assess systemic factors.

tooth_33.name: Tooth 33 (LL Canine)
tooth_33.hint: Guidance tooth; parafunction can cause notches/wear.

tooth_35.name: Tooth 35 (LL 2nd Premolar)
tooth_35.hint: Sharp on bite → crack vs high spot; dentist can test.

tooth_36.name: Tooth 36 (LL 1st Molar)
tooth_36.hint: Deep grooves → fissure caries; sealants useful in risk patients.

tooth_37.name: Tooth 37 (LL 2nd Molar)
tooth_37.hint: Chewing load high; cracks/inflammation if untreated decay.

tooth_38.name: Tooth 38 (LL 3rd Molar)
tooth_38.hint: Impaction common; pericoronitis causes painful swollen flap.

tooth_48_note.name: Note
tooth_48_note.hint: Fever + facial swelling = emergency; ADA: antibiotics only with systemic signs.
